titleInfo.title: ISOLATION AND CHARACTERIZATION OF TISSUE INHIBITORS OF METALLOPROTEINASES (TIMP-1 AND TIMP-2) FROM HUMAN RHEUMATOID SYNOVIAL-FLUID

mods.abstract: The tissue inhibitors of metalloproteinases TIMP-1 and TIMP-2 were purified to apparent homogeneity from human rheumatoid synovial fluid (HRSF). The inhibitors were isolated by dissociation of non-covalent gelatinase/TIMP complexes. TIMP-1 migrated as a single polypeptide with M(r) 28 500 on SDS-PAGE, while the M(r) of TIMP-2 was 21 000. The inhibitory activity was stable under heat and acid pH. N-terminal sequence data were obtained for the first 15 residues of both inhibitors and showed identity to the human fibroblast inhibitors TIMP-1 and TIMP-2. This is the first demonstration that TIMP-1 and TIMP-2 can be directly purified from human rheumatoid synovial fluid. The complex formation between the metalloproteinase inhibitors and leucocyte metalloproteinases was shown by immunoblotting.
